Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2010 01:14PM Janina wrote: They only confirmed cancer.  I will not know stage, grade, etc. until after surgery Wed when they check out my nodes.  I should know everything at end of next week.  I did have lupectomy and removed 3 cm lump (12 mm).
Posts.Title: Diagnosed today! Janina sweatyspice

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2010 05:43PM - edited Jan 16, 2010 05:45PM by Janina you are correct!!  Yeah! 12mm is 1.2 cm...not 3 cm...thanks for clearing this up!!  I am not sure why he did the lumpectomy last week and now surgery for nodes this week.  Wish he wouldve knocked them both out at one time!!  I am anxious to know what stage, grade, treatment, etc...
Posts.Title: Diagnosed today! Janina sweatyspice

Posts.Content: Janina wrote: Had a lumpectomy this morning. Pathologist confirmed cancer.  Will have surgery again next week to see if in nodes. If not, then doctor thinks I caught it early enough to be Stage I. I will know more after 2nd surgery. Lump was about 12mm. I was given 2 choices: masectomy or lumpectomy. I am going with lumpectomy. I will be 40 in April, so feel this is a good decision for me. I have a 19 yr old, 17 yr old and 2 yr old. I will BEAT this for the sake of my kiddos!! Was told may only have to do radiation, not chemo...but still not sure until 2nd surgery.  I pray NO CHEMO! dx at age 39. Lumpectomy with 1 microscopic node. Oncotype-33. CMF 6-cycles (2 wks on, 2 wks off), RADS & Tamoxifen to follow. Dx 1/14/2010, IDC, 1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 1/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Diagnosed today! Janina sweatyspice

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2010 06:18PM Janina wrote: Grade 3 is most aggressive.  Reason I am doing chemo.  I am doing CMF chemo, little side effects, no hair loss. Very doable!!
Posts.Title: Stage IIA with no Chemo yunlee72 Janina

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2010 07:31PM Janina wrote: I have been thinking the exact thing.  If I have a clear margin and the ONE node infected was removed, why radiation?  Mine is my left breast as well, so I have the worry of it effected my heart and I currently have a breast implant ans was told it MAY harden.  Only other option is mastectomy, but I am dead against it.
Posts.Title: Why do I need radiation? June2268 o2bhealthy

Posts.Content: Janina wrote: I found a lump in my left breast in November (probably thanks to losing weight).  I had a mammogram that showed lump abnormal and was sent immediately for an ultrasound.  The ultrasound showed abnormal as well. I am told that lump is a 12 mm, irregular solid sonolucent.  I was scheduled for an in-office needle biopsy this past week.  When I got there, the surgeon looked at the xrays and said he would prefer to put me to sleep and remove the entire lump (scheduled Thurs, Jan 14).  I asked what his feelings are just looking at the pics.  He said that he can usually get an idea whether cancerous or not just by looking at the xrays, but in my case, he cannot due to the lump not being smooth..being hard and irregular shaped.  He also said due to my family history (grandmother and 11 others-aunts, etc.- have died of breast cancer) that it is possible I could be carrying the gene.  Scarey!! Until recently, the breast did not hurt.  Now it has an irrating feeling, a burning sensation around the area of the lump. I am 39, turning 40 in April.  I have a 19 and 17 yr old and started over having a baby 2 yrs ago (which is why a recent loss in weight...still was working on getting baby fat off).  I am so scared at this point.  I have prepared for bad news, but praying for good!!  dx at age 39. Lumpectomy with 1 microscopic node. Oncotype-33. CMF 6-cycles (2 wks on, 2 wks off), RADS & Tamoxifen to follow. Dx 1/14/2010, IDC, 1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 1/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Janina wrote: I am starting CMF on Monday and was wondering if any of you could shed some light on it for me.  Tell me what side effects you have encountered, etc.  Please!!  Thank you!! I was originally offered TCx4 (over 12 wk period), but due to hair loss, asked about CMF.  I will do CMF for 6 mths on a 4 week cycle.  I will take a pill days 1-14 each month and have an injection on days 1 and 8 after that.  That covers 28 days...then start over. TM gave me a 92% "cure", whereas CMF gives me 88%, but is less toxic on my body with less side effects.  dx at age 39. Lumpectomy with 1 microscopic node. Oncotype-33. CMF 6-cycles (2 wks on, 2 wks off), RADS & Tamoxifen to follow. Dx 1/14/2010, IDC, 1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 1/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
